terms.heading1: BLiP Terms of Service and Privacy Policy
terms.heading2: Welcome to BLiP. We are a platform owned by TAKE that provides the use of applications for chatbots and other activities, and this term governs its use. According to this Term, "BLiP platform," or "Solution" means the features provided by BLiP, as well as all functionality associated with the use of the platform.
terms.p1: By clicking the button indicating your acceptance, you agree that complies with these Terms and with the use of the platform. If you are an employee/ representative of Client, you declares that you has been authorized by Client to agree to this Agreement on behalf of that Client or organization. In this case, "you" and "your" will refer to that Client or organization.
terms.p2: BLiP may amend or update this Agreement at any time to reflect changes in applicable law or service updates, or to incorporate new service or functionality.  If you do not agree to any changes made in this Agreement, you should discontinue using it. By continuing to use the platform, you express your agreement to be bound by the updated terms. Please review this Term from time to time.
terms.p3:
You may be asked to provide personal data, however before you start using the platform you will be asked to declare whether you agree to provide such data, as well as the treatment we will give to your information.
Our data retention policy is under constantly implementation in order to comply with the provisions of Brazilian data protection legislation, including Law 12.965/14 (Marco Civil da Internet). Personal data is collected to enable the use of BLiP and to direct improvements and evolutions in the platform, as well as to perform communications authorized by you on the platform, and are not shared with third parties.
terms.p4: As part of your relationship with us by using BLiP, you consent to receiving electronic communications relating to your account. These communications may involve sending emails to the email address provided in the registration or communications about BLiP on the "My Account" page and include notifications about your account (for example, payment authorizations, password changes or payment, confirmation emails and other information about the progress of chatbots projects). You agree that any notices, consents, disclosures or other communications sent by BLiP to you electronically satisfy the legal communications requirements. You must keep physical or electronic copies of electronic communications. You also agree to receive other communications, including communications about new features, special offers, promotional announcements, or other methods. If you no longer wish to receive communications, you may unsubscribe from the link in the emails sent to you by BLiP.
terms.p5: Neither this Term nor the use of the platform transfers to you the intellectual property of the platform or the content that you access through the service (in addition to its Content). This Agreement does not grant you any right to use the trademarks or other distinctive features of BLiP. The improper and unauthorized use of trademarks or other distinctive features of the BLiP may result in the suspension or termination of your use or the service and causes a duty to indemnify TAKE for moral and loss damages.
terms.p6: You represent and warrant that all information provided for the registration and use of the service is true, accurate and complete, and you must notify BLiP of any changes in such data within 24 (twenty four) hours.
terms.p7: You are responsible for your own content and must ensure that you have all rights and authorizations required to use the Content in relation to the platform. TAKE nor BLiP are responsible for any action you may take regarding your Content, including public sharing. Do not use any content on the platform unless you have obtained prior and legitimate authorization or if you have been authorized by law to do so. We do not allow certain types of content to be addressed on the platform. By using our service, you agree to our Content Policy.
terms.p8: You acknowledge that in order to ensure compliance with legal obligations, BLiP may need to review certain submitted content to determine if they are illegal or infringe this Agreement (as in the case of reporting illegal content to us). We may also change, block access, delete, or refuse to display content that we believe violates the law or this Agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, BLiP has no obligation to monitor or analyze any content submitted to the service.
terms.p9: You must use the service solely in compliance with applicable law.
terms.p10:
You are responsible for your conduct, your Content and your communications with others while using the service. By using the service, you must comply with the following requirements:
(a) You may not misuse our service by interfering with its normal operation or attempting to access it by any method other than the interfaces and instructions we provide;
(b) You may not evade any limitation imposed on your account by BLiP (such as opening a new account to conduct a search we have terminated for breach of the Terms.);
(c) You may not investigate, scan or test the vulnerability of any BliP system or network;
(d) You may not reverse engineer the service or attempt to do so;
(e) You may not transmit any viruses, malware, or other types of illegal software, or links to such software, through the service;
(f) You may not use the service to infringe the intellectual property rights of TAKE, BLIP, or a third party, nor to engage in illicit activity.
terms.p11: You must create an account to use BLiP. You are responsible for keeping your password secure, as well as any other credentials used to access that account. You, not BLiP, are responsible for any activity performed on your account (other than the activities for which BLiP is directly responsible) whether or not you have authorized such activities. If you become aware of any unauthorized access to your account, you must notify BLiP immediately. Accounts cannot be shared, each account must be used by only the authorized person.
terms.p12: You are responsible for maintaining, protecting, and backing up your Content. BLiP shall not be liable for any failure to store, for the loss or corruption of your Content.
terms.p13: BLiP may limit, suspend or cease to provide you the service if you fail to comply with this Agreement or if use the service in order to generate legal liability. TAKE or BLiP may also suspend the provision of the service if you are suspected of misconduct. If we suspend or terminate the service provided to you, we will do our best to notify you in advance so that you can export a copy of your Service Content.
terms.p14: If this Agreement is infringed in a continuous and offensive manner, BLiP may take measures to prevent you from continuing to use the service including, blocking your IP address.
terms.p15: BLiP makes constant changes and improvements in the service. We may add, change or remove the functionality of the service at any time without notice. BLiP may also limit, suspend or discontinue the service in its sole discretion. If BLiP discontinues the service, we will send you reasonable advance notice to allow you to export a copy of your Service Content.
terms.p16: Although the platform is always online, it is possible that there is periodic unavailability for several reasons. EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY PROVIDED IN THIS TERM AND TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, THE SERVICE IS PROVIDED ON AN "AS IS" BASIS, AND NEITHER BLIP NOR TAKE MAKES NO WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESS, IMPLIED OR STATUTORY, INCLUDING MERCHANTABILITY, ADEQUACY FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NON-INFRINGEMENT, AND RELATING TO THE AVAILABILITY, RELIABILITY OR ACCURACY OF THE SERVICE.
terms.p17: TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, BLIP, ITS OFFICERS, EMPLOYEES, AGENTS, SUPPLIERS, AND LICENSORS SHALL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, PUNITIVE, OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES OF ANY KIND, INCLUDING DAMAGES FOR LOSS OF PROFITS, AND LOSS OF DATA, RESULTING FROM OR RELATED TO THE SERVICE AND THIS TERM, ARE SUCH DAMAGES BASED ON CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR ANY OTHER LEGAL THEORY, EVEN IF BLiP HAS BEEN ADVISED OF POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES AND EVEN IF AN APPEAL DOES NOT FULFILL ITS ESSENTIAL PURPOSE.
terms.p18: Integral Agreement. This Agreement (including any Additional Terms) constitutes the entire agreement between you and BLiP and supersedes any other prior or contemporaneous agreements, terms and conditions, whether written or oral, relating to the subject matter. Any terms and conditions other than the present, are not applicable to the service, do not prevail over this Term, are not part of it and are void.
terms.p19: Contracting Parties. The relationship between you and TAKE (the owner of BLiP) is of independent contracting parties, not legal partners, employees or agents of the other party.
terms.p20: No waiver. If a party fails to execute a provision set forth in this Agreement or to delay in doing so shall not be construed as a waiver by that party to its right to do so at a later date.
terms.p21: Prevalence. If any conflict arises, the Additional Terms shall prevail over this Agreement in relation to the service to which the Additional Terms applies.
terms.p22: Individuality. If any provision of this Term is considered unenforceable by a court of competent jurisdiction the said provision shall be considered individually, and the other provisions shall remain in full force and effect.
terms.p23:
Governing Law and Venue: The laws of Brazil govern this term and any disputes that may arise between BLiP (Take) and You, without regard to conflict of law provisions.
It shall be elected by the PARTIES, with express waiver of any other, for more privileged that is, the forum of Belo Horizonte / MG, as the only one competent to resolve any doubts or controversy arising from this Term.

customerService.title: Customer Service
customerService.description: Answer your customers with human agents

details.title: Customer Service Bot
details.description:
With Customer Service Bot, it is possible to answer customers using the BLiP Desk tool.
The bot considers working hours and availability of agents, in addition to making reports that keep track of individual performance.

Goal: Facilitating a company's customer service on its main messaging channels.

resources.description: Add and change resources of your chatbot which . The resources can be used as content for the messages sent by the chatbot.
resources.help:
Key: The resource key for retrieving the value in the server when sending a resource message.

Type: The content MIME type which is used in the message 'type' property. Please check our documentation to get to know the supported content types.

Content: Text or JSON value of the resource which will replace the 'content' message property.

Please check our documentation to see usage examples.

provider.title: AI Providers
provider.subtitle: Choose and configure your artificial intelligence provider

watson.title: IBM Watson
watson.description: Go to the Bluemix panel and log in with your account. If you do not have one, sign up.

instructions.bluemix: Go to the Bluemix panel and log in with your account. If you do not have one, sign up.
instructions.conversation:
In the Bluemix dashboard, choose the Watson option and create a Conversation service.

It may have some API usage limits accordingly to the selected plan that can affect the usage of the service. It is required to have at least 3 available workspaces in your account to use the Conversation service on BLiP.
instructions.credentials:
In the details page of the created service, choose the Service credentials options on the side menu.

In the listed credentials, select the View credentials option, copy the username and password properties of the credentials JSON and paste in the fields bellow.

luis.title: Microsoft LUIS
luis.description: Access the Luis panel and log in with your account. If you don't have an account yet, create one.
luis.endpointKey: Endpoint Key or Azure Language Understanding Key

instructions.description: Access the Luis panel and log in with your account. If you don't have an account yet, create one.
instructions.authoringKeyTitle: 2 - How to get your Authoring Key
instructions.authoringKey:
The Authoring Key is created automatically by LUIS account. This key allows you to create and edit your application using the LUIS APIs.
To find it, log in to https://www.luis.ai and click on the account name in the upper-right navigation bar to open Account Settings, which display the Authoring Key.
instructions.endpointKey:
If you need more than 1000 requests per month, you can purchase a Microsoft Azure Language Understanding (LUIS) Key. You can use an authoring key, but it has a limit of 1000 requests per month. These keys are used to publish your applications to the Web.

To learn how to manage your keys go to this link. If you use an Endpoint Key purchased in Microsoft Azure you need to associate this key with your application in the Luis panel , without this association it is not possible to analyze the user's sentences in BLiP.

dialogflow.title: DialogFlow
dialogflow.description: Give users new ways to interact with your product by building engaging voice and text-based coversational interfaces, such as voice apps and chatsbots, powered by AI.

config.title: Configure Dialogflow
config.activation: To activate the integration you have to create an account at DialogFlow
config.postAction: After you create the account, create a new agent and then click on the gear icon to access the configurations. Clicking at the Service Account link, you will be redirect to the Google Cloud Platform.
config.adminSet: Create an service account then select Admin at the Dialogflow API as a project role and check "Supply a new private key" as a JSOn. Now, you only have to complete the fields below and finish it.

tooltips.precision: Indicates if the bot is not mistaking intents
tooltips.recall: Indicates of ythe bot is not letting pass intents
tooltips.f1: Combines precision and recall bringing a unique number that indicates the models's general quality

blipchat.title: BLiP Chat (deprecated)
blipchat.description: BLiP Chat gets you closer to your customers, making your embedded chatbot available on your site or on your Android or iOS apps.
blipchat.apiKeyDescription: Use the API KEY to integrate your application to BLiP Chat:
blipchat.urlDescription: Your chatbot is available here.
blipchat.domainDescription: Add domains where you will make available your chatbot. Type ENTER to separate them.
blipchat.webConfigDescription: Add this script on your web page body. For advanced configurations access the documentation. Remember to add a valid domain.
blipchat.mobileDescription: For the integration on mobile apps, access our documents Android e iOS.
blipchat.displayNameDescription: This name will be displayed to your users when they open BLiP Chat
blipchat.displayNameDetails: Display name is an optional BLiP Chat configuration. It will be displayed to your users as follow:

blipchat2.title: BLiP Chat
blipchat2.apiKeyDescription: Use the API KEY to integrate your application to BLiP Chat:

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: BLiP Chat gets you closer to your customers, making your embedded chatbot available on your site or on your Android or iOS apps.

configs.title: Configurations
configs.displayNameTip: This name will be displayed to your users when they open BLiP Chat
configs.domainsTip: Add domains where you will make available your chatbot. Type ENTER to separate them.
configs.receiveFilesTip: When this option is selected the user will have the option to send a file to the bot
configs.iconTip: To update the icon in your BLiP Chat copy the automatic generated script in the Setup tab

setup.title: Setup
setup.webConfigDescription: Add this script on your web page body. For advanced configurations access the documentation. Remember to add a valid domain.
setup.mobileDescription: For the integration on mobile apps, access our documents Android e iOS.

email.tutorial: It is necessary to configure an account for your chatbot to send and receive e-mails, with IMAP protocol support. The ideal is to have this exclusive account, that is, that it is not used for other purposes than messages exchange of your chatbot. We recommend to use the Gmail for this purpose. Create a free account now.

facebook.title: Messenger
facebook.description: Your chatbot will be accessed through a Facebook page. For this reason, it is important that you create a page for your company on Facebook. If your company has a page already, you may use it.
facebook.createPage: Create a new page on Facebook
facebook.alreadyPublishedBody:
The selected page is already published on another application.

Unpublish before publishing again, or use another page for this app.
facebook.deactivateAlienPageBody:
The active page belongs to other Facebookโs user. Thus, when deactivating it, it will no longer be visible on your pages list.

Are you sure you want to deactivate it?

chat.description:
To use the customer chat plugin, you must:

  • Whitelist the domain of your website
  • Include the Facebook JavaScript SDK in the page
  • Include the plugin on your webpage
chat.script: The following snippet of code will give the basic version of the SDK where the options are set to their most common defaults. You should insert it directly after the opening tag on each page you want to load it:
chat.plugin: To add the plugin to your webpage, include a div with the following attributes in your HTML:

overview.title: Overview
overview.description:
Scale and deliver in a confidential way your
corporate SMS messages in the whole world.

step1.title: Connecting with Infobip
step1.description:
To activate Infobip integration, you need to be registered
in the platform and fill the information bellow:

step2.title:
Numbers that will receive SMS
as chatbot {{botName}}
step2.description: Activate the numbers that will receive messages and select the number to answer your clients by default:
step2.noResults: Your account does not have purchased numbers. Buy a number directly with Infobip.

modal.deleteText:
When you disable Infobip channel, you will lose
all credentials already set up.

mailgun.title: E-mail
mailgun.description: Your chatbot has a standard e-mail address. Your customers may interact through this address.
mailgun.label: E-mail

skype.title: Skype
skype.acquireApplicationIdDescription:
Access the Application Registration Portal Microsoft and create a new app. Inform the name of your chatbot.

Fill the BLiP field Application ID with Application ID informed on the portal,according to the image below:
skype.acquirePasswordDescriptionP1: On the same registration screen of the app, click on Generate Password.
skype.acquirePasswordDescriptionP2: On BLiP, activate the channel and click on Save. A callback URL will be generated.
skype.createChatbotDescriptionP1: Access the BotFramework Portal using your Microsoft account, and create a new bot using your Application ID.
skype.createChatbotDescriptionP2: Copy the callback Url generated by BLiP and paste it in the field Messaging endpoint of BotFramework, according to the above image. Fill in the rest of the form and make the registration.
skype.testingDescriptionP1: After making the registration, a page will be displayed, it contains some information about the bot. In order to test it you need to add it to your contacts on Skype by clicking on Skype under Channels and start a conversation through Skype application. Do not test it using the Test button on the right upper corner.
skype.testingDescriptionP2: In order for your bot to operate on Skype, their team needs to approve it first.
skype.testingDescriptionP3: So, you must go to BotFramework Portal using your Microsoft account and click on My Bots. The existent bots will be listed on this screen. Select the bot want to make available on Skype and click on Edit in Skype channel. Then click on Publish, fill in all the required data and click Submit for Review. Your bot will then be analized by Skype team.
skype.testingDescriptionP4: If your bot is not approved you may only be able test it with the same Skype account that you created the bot.

sms.description: Activate this channel and get a telephone number for your chatbot. Your customers will be able to interact with you through this number.

takeio.title: SMS
takeio.description:
O parameter below belongs to your user of TakeIo. It is available on tab Development, on the menu Key Access.

After fulfilling the field, list your available accounts and choose one to use the SMS channel.

We recommend to use an exclusive account for your chatbot.

telegram.title: Telegram
telegram.installTelegram:
Install the Telegram and access the @botfather.

To create your Telegram Bot, send the command /newbot.
telegram.giveUniqueName: An unique name for your Telegram Bot.
telegram.afterToken: After following the steps above, Telegram will make token available, according to the message below:

workplace.title: Workplace Chat
workplace.description:
Your chatbot will be accessed through your company Workplace, so make sure it is deployed (see more information here).

Remember only System Administrators of a Workplace community can create apps and generate access tokens in that community.
workplace.introduction:
Your chatbot will be accessed through your company Workplace, so make sure it is deployed (see more information here).

Remember only System Administrators of a Workplace community can create apps and generate access tokens in that community.
workplace.goToIntegration: Go to Integrations in the company's Dashboard.
workplace.customIntegration: On the bottom of the page click on Create Custom Integration
workplace.describeApp: Inform a name and a description for the app, click on Create
workplace.copyToken: The Edit Custom Integration dialog will open after creating the app. The Page Access Token will be needed for later. Generate it clicking on the Access Token button. Copy the token and paste it in a temporary location (this token will be shared with you only once). Copy also the App Secret you will need set this informations on BLiP.
workplace.permissions: In the Permissions section select Read content and Message any member.
workplace.webhook: In Configure Webhooks specify the callback URL and the Verify Token with bellow values
workplace.enableEvents: Check message_deliveries, messages, messaging_postbacks and message_reads on Subscription Fields, then click Save.
workplace.seeWork: Click on Messages then click on See All In Work Chat on the bottom of the dialog.
workplace.nameApp: Type the name of your App in the search field of Work Chat.
workplace.appId: Click on your App in the search result list and copy your App ID from the URL.
workplace.blipConnection:
After creating the Workplace App provide in the fields below the App Id from chat URL and the Access Token and App Secret you copied earlier from the Edit Custom Integration dialog.

Once you save the form your app will be published on Workplace.

whatsapp.title: Whatsapp
whatsapp.description: Activate this channel and read the QRCODE.

overview.title: Overview
overview.description:
Make customer service on the most used channel in the world.
With WhatsApp, your messages are faster, simpler and valuable*.
overview.manual:
I already have an official contact/
I want to activate it manually
overview.detail: *Customer support messages are free of charge, but informational notifications will be charged. Contact us to know more!

step1.title: BLiP WhatsApp
step1.description: To activate WhatsApp integration, you need to be signed up on Facebook for Developers and create an official contact.

step2.description: Enter the phone number and verified name (VName) certificate from your WhatsApp Business Account.
step2.pincodeQuestion: Does your number have a PIN?
step2.pincodeWarning: If you have already set up a PIN, enter it below. Ignoring this step can cause errors during account activation.
step2.regTitle: WhatsApp will send the registration code to the number you signed up!
step2.regDescription: Please, wait until WhatsApp sends the registration code to your number via the chosen method. This process can take some time because it needs authorization from WhatsApp.
step2.codePlaceholder: Enter the code sent by WhatsApp
step2.payAttentionOnCode: Don't forget to write the number. If you want to generate a new code, wait until next code is available.

step3.statusPlaceholder: Ex: BLiP is now on WhatsApp :)
step3.descPlaceholder: Ex: BLiP is the best platform to create, manage and evolve smart contacts.

modal.deleteText: When you disable WhatsApp channel, you will lose all credentials already set up.
modal.pincodeText: This phone has two-step verification enabled. Please, enter its PIN to advance.

pagSeguro.pagSeguroPainel:
Access the Pagseguro panel with your e-mail address.

Create a seller account in case you do not have yet and login.
pagSeguro.pagseguroToken:
After login, access the menu Panel > My account > Preferences > Integrations.

Choose the option Generate token, copy the value and insert it on the form below, together with your e-mail of your Pagseguro account.

faq2.scoreSubtitle: Set the accuracy level of your bot's responses

Configure how your chatbot will behave to the received questions. After that, train and publish your model through the Artificial intelligence menu.

For information about how to configure and use the FAQ template, consult our documentation.
faq2.scoreThresholdDescription: Mininal intent score percentage to consider it as an valid answer for a question
faq2.feedbackSubtitle: Configure your bot to ask for feedback
faq2.askFeedbackDescription: Ask customer feedback for each sent aswer.
faq2.positiveFeedbackDescription: Text of the button which is sent to the user to inform that the provided answer is valid for the question
faq2.negativeFeedbackDescription: Text of the button which is sent to the user to inform that the provided answer is not valid for the question
faq2.thanksForFeedbackDescription: Optional thank-you message to be sent to every feedback received from the user

master.description: Add sub-bots as services in your main chatbot.

master.redirectTimeoutDescription: Time threshould in seconds that this bot should be active in the conversation since the last interaction of the client

attendance.outOfOfficeMessage: Hello, thanks for getting in contact! Iโm away at the moment, but Iโll get in contact at my opening hours.
attendance.name: Manual Service
attendance.instructions: In order to serve your clients, access web.blip.ai.
attendance.instructions2: Your attendance will receive your customersโ messages on this channel
attendance.notShow: This name will not be displayed to your customers
attendance.zendeskInstructions: Your chatbot will be accessed through an account on Zendesk. For this reason it is important to create an account. In case your company already has one, you can use it.
attendance.apiTokenInstructions: Access the page Admin > Channels > API and add a new token or use an existent one.
attendance.zendeskEmail: E-mail used to get in the Zendesk
attendance.emailInstructions:
Your agent will use an e-mail address to receive messages from customers and to answer them.

When answering, it is important to not change the e-mail subject so we know to which customer the agent is answering.

It is necessary to publish your chatbot on the channel E-mail. For this, on the side menu, choose Channels -> E-mail informing the requested data.
attendance.emailInstructions2: Your agent will receive messages from your customers on this e-mail
attendance.firstMessageInstructions: Write a message to your customers that will get in contact out of the working time.
attendance.firstMessageDesc: Choose a message your customers will receive for the first time they interact with your chatbot.
attendance.answerYourClients: How will I answer the customers?
attendance.attendanceUnavailableDesc: Choose a message for your customer to receive when there is no available atendance.
attendance.zendeskToken: How to acquire the API Token

persistentMenu.title: Persistent Menu

persistentMenu.persistentMenuRequirement: In order to define the persistent menu, it is necessary to define the action button

integrations.title: Integrations
integrations.description: Connect your chatbot with more than 200 online tools

chatbase.title: Chatbase
chatbase.description: Send chatbot data to your Chatbase account

instructions.insertUrl:
To activate this integration, go to your Chatbase account, and copy your bot's API Key which should be available:

  • When crating a new bot
  • In your "My Bots" page
instructions.description:
After copying it, go to your bot's integration configurations page, and copy your API Key in the "Chatbase Bot API Key" field.

Finally, click the Activate switch to enble this integration.
instructions.note: Note: Chatbase may have a 15 minute delay to update your bot's information.

webhook.title: Webhook
webhook.description: Send chatbot data to your application

documentation.insertUrl:
Insert an URL of some application to BLiP send all analytics informations of your chatbot

Example: https://requestb.in/14rxsmm1
documentation.description:
This trigger fires every time your bot send or receives messages to notify your application about this event.

Note: This URL must be prepared to receive a POST HTTP request with a Message object on Body
documentation.sample: Example: Request when your chatbot receives a message from Facebook user:

rdstation.title: RDStation
rdstation.description: Send chatbot data to your RDStation account

documentation.insertUrl:
To activate this integration, go to your RDStation account, and copy your Token which should be available here:

https://app.rdstation.com.br/integracoes/tokens.

After copying it, go to your bot's integration configurations page, and copy your Token in the "RDStation's Public Token" field.

Finally, click the Activate switch to enble this integration.
documentation.description:
In oder to create new lead conversions into your RDStation account, you must send a command of type event-track, with the fields category: "lead", and action: "create".

The command must have at least the following two fields as extras: email and identificador; if any of these parameters were invalid/undefined, the lead will not be saved.

There are other optional fields you can send to complement the lead's informaton, check out this link for more infomation.
documentation.sample: Example: HTTP Request made to save the lead:

variables.bucket: Document stored at the bot's bucket. The '?' must be replaced by the document's ID saved in the bucket
variables.config: Global variables defined at the flow configuration where the '?' must be replaced by the desired value

contact.name: Contact's name
contact.extras: A generic JSON to store tuples of strings (key, value)
contact.identity: Contact's identity in the name@domain format
contact.group: Name of the group to which the contact is

calendar.datetime: Current GMT-0 date and time (in the yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ format)
calendar.date: Current GMT-0 date (in the yyyy-MM-dd format)
calendar.time: Current GMT-0 time (in the HH:mm format)
calendar.unixTimeMilliseconds: Current date in the Unix timestamp format (milliseconds)
calendar.unixTime: Current date in the Unix timestamp format
calendar.dayOfWeek: Today's index in the week (where 0 is Sunday and 6 is Saturday)

tomorrow.datetime: Tomorrow's GMT-0 date and time (in the yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ format)
tomorrow.date: Tomorrow's GMT-0 date (in the yyyy-MM-dd format)
tomorrow.day: Tomorrow's day at the current month
tomorrow.time: Tomorrow's current GMT-0 time (in the HH:mm format)
tomorrow.unixTimeMilliseconds: Tomorrow's date in the Unix timestamp format (milliseconds)
tomorrow.unixTime: Tomorrow's date in the Unix timestamp format
tomorrow.dayOfWeek: Tomorrow's index in the week (where 0 is Sunday and 6 is Saturday)

yesterday.datetime: Yesterday's GMT-0 date and time (in the yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ format)
yesterday.date: Yesterday's GMT-0 date (in the yyyy-MM-dd format)
yesterday.day: Yesterday's day number in the month
yesterday.time: Yesterday's current GMT-0 time (in the HH:mm format)
yesterday.unixTimeMilliseconds: Yesterday's date in the Unix timestamp format (milliseconds)
yesterday.unixTime: Yesterday's date in the Unix timestamp format
yesterday.dayOfWeek: Yesterday's index in the week (where 0 is Sunday and 6 is Saturday)

input.content: Content of message sent by user

entity.id: Identifier of the recognized entity (where ? must be replaced by the entity's name)
entity.name: Name of the recognized entity (where ? must be replaced by the entity's name)
entity.value: Value of the recognized entity (where ? must be replaced by the entity's name)

intent.name: Name of the recognized intent
intent.score: Reliability linked to the recognized intent
intent.answer: One of the answers linked to the recognized intent

input.length: Quantity of content itens inside message sent by user (only for Collections)
input.type: Type of message sent by user
input.message: The message received by the bot

state.id: Identifier of current block in the flow
state.name: Name of current block in the flow

previous.id: Identifier of the previous block in the flow
previous.name: Name of the previous block in the flow
